newsitem.title: UK: United Technologies axes 93 jobs in Londonderry.
newsitem.headline: United Technologies axes 93 jobs in Londonderry.

text.p: United Technologies Automotive (UK) Ltd, which makes electrical wiring harnesses, announced 93 job losses at its Londonderry, Northern Ireland, plant on Thursday.
A UTA statement said the move was a result of a cut in the plant's business with Jaguar following a downturn in sales of its X300 model.
It said that "a drop in sales of the Jaguar X300 ...had resulted in orders... being reduced by 25 per cent."
The company said the cuts were unavoidable and that the plant's survival depended on achieving and sustaining high efficiency and lower costs.
The factory "currently employs around 625 people and will remain one of the city's largest employers," the statement added.
